intro: Orchis × angusticruris nothosubsp. angusticruris, commonly known as the narrow-legged orchid, is a hybrid species within the Orchidaceae family. It exhibits characteristics of both its parent species, Orchis morio and Orchis anthropophora, with a distinctive narrow, elongated labellum. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous habitats such as woodlands and meadows. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish in color, with a prominent spurred ovary. This nothosubspecies is of particular interest to botanists due to its hybrid nature and ecological adaptability.
